context_bundle.summary: Go testing patterns with table-driven tests, benchmarks, fuzzing, test coverage, and testing best practices

onboarding.quick_start: go test ./... -v && go test -cover ./... && go test -bench=. -benchmem
common_patterns: Table tests: 'tests := []struct{ input int; want int }{{1, 2}, {2, 4}}; for _, tt := range tests { t.Run(fmt.Sprint(tt.input), func(t *testing.T) { got := double(tt.input); if got != tt.want { t.Errorf("got %d, want %d", got, tt.want) } }) }'
Subtests: 't.Run("subtest name", func(t *testing.T) { /* test code */ })' for organization
Benchmarks: 'func BenchmarkFunction(b *testing.B) { for i := 0; i < b.N; i++ { function() } }'
Fuzzing: 'func FuzzFunction(f *testing.F) { f.Add("seed"); f.Fuzz(func(t *testing.T, input string) { function(input) }) }'
Test helpers: 'func testHelper(t *testing.T) { t.Helper(); /* helper code */ }' to improve error messages
Parallel tests: 't.Parallel()' at start of test function for concurrent execution
Mock interfaces: 'type MockReader struct { ReadFunc func([]byte) (int, error) }; func (m *MockReader) Read(p []byte) (int, error) { return m.ReadFunc(p) }'
known_errors: test timeout: Increase with 'go test -timeout 30s' or optimize slow tests
race condition in test: Run 'go test -race', fix synchronization issues
benchmark unstable: Run multiple times 'go test -bench=. -count=10', check for external factors
coverage not accurate: Ensure all code paths tested, use '-covermode=atomic' for concurrent code
fuzzing crash: Examine crash input with 'go test -fuzz=FuzzName -fuzztime=10s'
test cache: Clear with 'go clean -testcache' if tests not running
